titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the William Everett lecture transcription 1977.661
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:17:35 +0000.

did.abstract: A transcription of a lecture titled, "Some English Friends in America in 1766", delivered by William Everett at the Long Island Historical Society (later known as the Brooklyn Historical Society) in the 1860s.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The item was formally accessioned in 1977.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); William Everett lecture, 1977.661, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
